sen.j: 山田川駅（やまだがわえき）は、京都府相楽郡精華町大字山田小字下河原3-1にある、近畿日本鉄道（近鉄）近鉄京都線の鉄道駅。
sen.e: Yamadagawa Station (Yamadagawa-eki) is a railway station on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line of Kintetsu Corporation
sen.cmt: 近畿日本鉄道（近鉄）→Kintetsu Corporation [http://www.kintetsu.jp]
sen.e: Yamadagawa Station (Yamadagawa-eki) is a railway facility on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line (operated by the Kintetsu Corporation).

Yamadagawa Station, located at 3-1, Koaza Shimogawara, Oaza Yamada, Seika-cho, Soraku-gun, Kyoto Prefecture, is a railway facility on the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, which is operated by the Kintetsu Corporation.

sen.j: 木津川市との境界上にある。
sen.e: It is bordered by the Kizu-gawa River
It is bordered by the Kizu-gawa River.
It is bordered by the Kizu-gawa River.

sen.j: 駅構造
sen.e: Station structurea
The station's structure
Station layout
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: プラットホーム2面2線の地上駅である。
sen.e: It is a ground station equipped with a two-side and two-tracked platform.
It's a ground station equipped with a two-sided platform serving two tracks.
It's a ground station equipped with a two-sided platform serving two tracks.

sen.j: ホーム長が短く、4両編成しか停車できない。
sen.e: The platform length is not long enough to permit the trains made up of more than 4 cars.
The platform length isn't long enough to permit the trains of more than four cars.
The platform length isn't long enough to permit the trains of more than four cars.

sen.j: 駅西側、2番ホームに駅舎があり、反対側の1番ホームへは構内踏切を利用して渡る（2007年11月時点では、京都線内唯一の構内踏切でもある）。
sen.e: On the west side of the station, on the platform No2, the station building is constructed, and a yard crossing is used to go to the platform No.1(as of November 2007, this is the only yard crossing that exists on the Kyoto Line).

On the west side of the station, on platform No. 2, the station building is constructed, and a yard crossing is used to go to platform No. 1 (as of November 2007, this is the only yard crossing on the Kyoto Line).

On the west side of the station, on Platform 2, the station building is constructed, and a yard crossing is used to go to Platform 1 (as of November 2007, this is the only yard crossing on the Kyoto Line).
sen.cmt: Platform と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 便所は2番ホームにあり、男女別の水洗式便所（2008年2月よりかつて存在した汲み取り式便所の隣に新たなトイレの建設工事を施行し、約１ヶ月の工事期間を経て完成し使用可能となり、汲み取り式便所は閉鎖・撤去された）。
sen.e: The toilet facility, located on the platform No.2, is equipped with a flush toilet (installation of a new toilet was carried out from February 2008 next to the vault toilet that was existing at that time, and after about a month of work, the completed new toilet was rendered available and consequently the vault toilet was closed and removed).
sen.cmt: 汲み取り式便所 →vault toilet [英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: The toilet facility, located on platform No. 2, is equipped with a flush toilet (the installation of a new toilet was carried out in February 2008 next to the vault toilet that existed at the time, and after about a month of work the newly completed toilet was made available; consequently, the vault toilet was closed and removed).

The toilet facility, located on Platform 2, is equipped with a flush toilet (the installation of a new toilet was carried out in February 2008 next to the vault toilet that existed at the time, and after about a month of work the newly completed toilet was made available; consequently, the vault toilet was closed and removed).
sen.cmt: Platform と大文字にしました。

sen.j: 但し、多目的トイレは設置されていない。
sen.e: However, the toilet is not multi-purposed.
However, the toilet is not multipurpose.
However, the toilet is not multipurpose.

sen.j: なお自動改札機は東芝製が設置されており、赤い自動改札機（EG-2000）は出場時2枚一括処理、PiTaPa・ICOCAに対応する。
sen.e: Automatic ticket gates made by Toshiba are installed, and a red colored automatic ticket gate (EC-2000) has 2-ticket processing function at outgoing ticket usage check and accepts PiTaPa and ICOCA.
sen.cmt: 出場時→定訳不明「鉄道技術用語辞典(自動改札機の入出場検査→ticket usage check) http://yougo.rtri.org.jp/dic/をもとに、at outgoing ticket usage checkとしました]、2枚一括処理→ (2-ticket processing function [東芝文献（東芝レビュー）：http://www.toshiba.co.jp/tech/review/2000/01/f01.pdf]
sen.e: Automatic ticket gates made by Toshiba are installed, and a red-colored automatic ticket gate (EC-2000) has the two-ticket processing function at the outgoing ticket usage check; it accepts PiTaPa and ICOCA.

Automatic ticket gates made by Toshiba are installed, and a red-colored automatic ticket gate (EG-2000) has the two-ticket processing function at the outgoing ticket usage check; it accepts PiTaPa and ICOCA.

sen.j: また定期券の予約発売を実施している。
sen.e: The commuter ticket is sold by prescription.
The commuter ticket is sold by prescription.
The commuter ticket is sold by prescription.

sen.j: 利用状況
sen.e: Utilization situation
Passenger usage statistics
Passenger use
sen.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 2005年11月8日の調査結果によると、1日の利用客は4786人。
sen.e: According to the survey made on November 8, 2005, the number of the users a day was 4786.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, the number of the users that day was 4,786.
According to a survey conducted on November 8, 2005, the number of the users that day was 4,786.

sen.j: 近鉄の全調査対象駅（323駅、但し調査当時の数）中、122位。
sen.e: This is the 122nd position out of all the stations of Kintetsu Railway targeted by the survey (323 stations, as of the date of survey).
This is the 122nd position out of all the stations of Kintetsu Railway targeted by the survey (323 stations as of the survey date).
This is the 122nd position out of all the stations of Kintetsu Railway targeted by the survey (323 stations as of the survey date).

sen.j: 京都線の駅（26駅、大和西大寺駅含む）の中では、20位。
sen.e: It ranks the 20th out of all the stations on the Kyoto Line (26 stations including Yamato-Saidaiji Station
It ranks twentieth out of all the stations on the Kyoto Line (26, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
It ranks twentieth out of all the stations on the Kyoto Line (26, including Yamato-Saidaiji Station).

sen.j: 京都府内の近鉄の駅（23駅）の中では、18位。
sen.e: It ranks the 18th out of all the Kintetsu Railway stations within Kyoto City (23 stations).
It ranks eighteenth out of all the Kintetsu Railway stations within Kyoto City (23 stations).
It ranks eighteenth out of all the Kintetsu Railway stations within Kyoto City (23 stations).

sen.j: 地元住民の利用が主である。
sen.e: The principal users are local residents.
The principal users are local residents.
The principal users are local residents.

sen.j: 通学にも使われている。
sen.e: It is also used by students to go to school.
It's also used by students for the commute to school.
It's also used by students for the commute to school.

tit.cmt: 他の記事と統一しました。

sen.j: 近年駅前に商業施設が整備され、利便性が増した。
sen.e: Commercial facilities have been developed in front of the station and the convenience in the vicinity was enhanced.
Commercial facilities have been developed in front of the station, whereby the convenience of the area has been enhanced.
Commercial facilities have been developed in front of the station, whereby the convenience of the area has been enhanced.

sen.j: 川を挟んで対岸に国道163号山田川バイパスが走っている。
sen.e: On the opposite side of the river, Yamadagawa Bypass of National Route 163 is running.
sen.cmt: 国道163号山田川バイパス→定訳不明 [Yamadagawa Bypass of National Route 163としました]
sen.e: Yamadagawa Bypass of National Route 163 runs on the opposite side of the river.
Yamadagawa Bypass of National Route 163 runs on the opposite side of the river.

sen.j: 駅から至る道は旧国道163号だが、やや狭い。
sen.e: The road that leads from the station to the bypass is the former National Route 163, but it is relatively narrow.
The road that leads from the station to the bypass is the former National Route 163, but it's relatively narrow.
The road that leads from the station to the bypass is the former National Route 163, but it's relatively narrow.

sen.j: 駅前から奈良交通のほか、コミュニティバスである木津町巡回バス及び精華くるりんバスも連絡している。
sen.e: In addition to the bus service provided by Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd., community bus services, Kizu-cho Circular Bus (Kizu-cho Junkai-bus) and Seika Kururin Bus, are available in front of the station.
sen.cmt: 奈良交通→Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd [http://www.narakotsu.co.jp/]、 木津町巡回バス→定訳不明 [Kizu-cho Circular Bus (Kizu-cho Junkai-bus)としました]、精華くるりんバス→ Seika Kururin Bus[http://www-e.town.seika.kyoto.jp/htmls_img/2005July.pdf]

sen.j: かつては加茂駅 (京都府)、笠置町、月ヶ瀬駅口、伊賀市方面行きのバスも発着していた。
sen.e: In the past, there were bus services for Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture), Kasagi-cho, Tsukigaseeki-guchi, Iga City.
Formerly, there were bus services for Kamo Station (Kyoto Prefecture), Kasagi-cho, Tsukigaseeki-guchi, Iga City.

sen.j: 現在もバス乗り場案内板にその跡（文字）が残っている。
sen.e: At present the descriptions on these routes can be still traced on the information board at the bus station.
Today, the descriptions on these routes can still be traced on the information board at the bus station.

sen.j: 歴史
sen.e: History
History
History

sen.j: 1928年（昭和3年）11月3日 -奈良電気鉄道桃山御陵前駅～西大寺（現・大和西大寺駅）間開通時に開業。
sen.e: November 3, 1928: The station opened when Nara Electric Railway began operating between Momoyamagoryomae Station and Saidaiji Station (current Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
sen.cmt: 奈良電気鉄道→Nara Electric Railway [http://www.fundinguniverse.com/company-histories/KINKI-NIPPON-RAILWAY-COMPANY-LTD-Company-History.html]
sen.e: November 3, 1928: The station opened when Nara Electric Railway began operating between Momoyamagoryomae Station and Saidaiji Station (currently Yamato-Saidaiji Station).
November 3, 1928: The station opened when Nara Electric Railway began operating between Momoyamagoryomae Station and Saidaiji Station (currently Yamato-Saidaiji Station).

sen.j: 1963年（昭和38年）10月1日 - 会社合併により近畿日本鉄道の駅となる。
sen.e: October 1, 1963: With the merger of the company, it became a station of Kintetsu Corporation.
sen.cmt: 近畿日本鉄道（近鉄）→Kintetsu Corporation [http://www.kintetsu.jp]
sen.e: October 1, 1963: It became a station of Kintetsu Corporation due to the merger of the company.
October 1, 1963: It became a station of Kintetsu Corporation due to the merger of the company.

sen.j: 2007年（平成19年）4月1日 - PiTaPa使用開始。
sen.e: April 1, 2007: PiTaPa became operable at the station.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa became accepted at the station.
April 1, 2007: PiTaPa became accepted at the station.

sen.j: 近鉄京都線の前身、奈良電気鉄道時代には同社直営の路線バスがあり、古くからバスターミナルとしての性格を持っていた。
sen.e: In the time of Nara Electric Railway, the predecessor of the Kintetsu Kyoto Line, the company provided route bus services under its direct operation, and therefore, the station had been functioning as a bus terminal since a long time ago.
sen.cmt: 路線バス→route bus[英辞郎 on the WEB]
sen.e: In the time of the Nara Electric Railway (the predecessor of the Kintetsu Kyoto Line), the company provided route bus services under its direct operation, and therefore the station has longed functioned as a bus terminal.

In the time of the Nara Electric Railway (the predecessor of the Kintetsu Kyoto Line), the company provided route bus services under its direct operation, and therefore the station has long functioned as a bus terminal.

sen.j: 1995年までは国道163号を走り笠置町、伊賀市（三重県）方面へ向かう路線があったが廃止された。
sen.e: Until 1995, there was a route bus service for Kasagi-cho and Iga City (Mie Prefecture) running through National Route 163, however it was discontinued.
Prior to 1995, there was a route bus service for Kasagi-cho and Iga City (Mie Prefecture) running through National Route 163, but it was eventually discontinued.
Prior to 1995, there was a route bus service for Kasagi-cho and Iga City (Mie Prefecture) running through National Route 163, but it was eventually discontinued.

sen.j: 合併以降は近鉄系の会社（京都近鉄観光バス、車庫が木津川市山城町 (京都府)上狛にあった。現在は近物レックス南京都支店）
sen.e: After the merger, the company was taken by a subsidiary of Kintetsu Corporation (Kyoto Kintetsu Tour Bus, which had its depot in Kamikoma, Yamashiro-cho, Kizukawa City (Kyoto Prefecture); currently Kinbutsu Rex Minami-Kyoto Branch is located).
sen.cmt: 近物レックス南京都支店→Kinbutsu Rex Minami-Kyoto Branch [http://www.kinbutsurex.co.jp/]
sen.e: After the merger, the company was taken over by a subsidiary of Kintetsu Corporation (Kyoto Kintetsu Tour Bus, which had its depot in Kamikoma, Yamashiro-cho, Kizukawa City (Kyoto Prefecture); currently, the Kinbutsu Rex Minami-Kyoto Branch is located there)).

After the merger, the company was taken over by a subsidiary of Kintetsu Corporation (Kyoto Kintetsu Tour Bus, which had its depot in Kamikoma, Yamashiro-cho (Kyoto Prefecture), Kizugawa City; currently, the Kinbutsu Rex Minami-Kyoto Branch is located there).
sen.cmt: 京都府 の位置を移動しました。

sen.j: →近鉄バス（当時は近鉄直営）に引き継がれ、1973年に現在の奈良交通の路線となっている。
sen.e: After that, it was succeeded by Kintetsu Bus Co., Ltd (at that time, directly operated by Kintetsu Corporation), and since 1973, the route has been operated by Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd.
sen.cmt: 近鉄バス→Kintetsu Bus Co., Ltd
sen.e: Subsequently, it was succeeded by Kintetsu Bus Co., Ltd. (then directly operated by Kintetsu Corporation), and since 1973 the route has been operated by Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd.
Subsequently, it was succeeded by Kintetsu Bus Co., Ltd. (then directly operated by Kintetsu Corporation), and since 1973 the route has been operated by Nara Kotsu Bus Lines Co., Ltd.

sen.j: 駅南方には京奈和自動車道の高架橋がそびえ、開発の進展を実感させられる。
sen.e: To the south of the station, there is an dominant viaduct of Keinawa Expressway representing the development progress that the station has witnessed.
To the south of the station there is a prominent viaduct of the Keinawa Expressway, which represents the development progress that the station has witnessed.
To the south of the station there is a prominent viaduct of the Keinawa Expressway, which represents the development progress that the station has witnessed.
